question: Which all countries are included in the "Horn of Africa"?
explanation: The Horn of Africa takes its name from the horn-shaped land formation that forms the easternmost point of the African continent, projecting into the Indian Ocean south of the Arabian Peninsula. More specifically, this region forms adjacent countries located at the southern end of the Red Sea and on the Gulf of Aden:- Eritrea, Djibouti, Somalia and landlocked Ethiopia. It is located on the main shipping route for the transport of oil from the Persian Gulf to Europe and the United States of America, the Horn of Africa is considered one of the most strategically important regions in the world.
